extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClientCommunication

        public ClientCommunication(java.net.Socket socket,
                           view.ClientTUI view,
                           java.lang.String name,
                           model.Strategy strategy,
                           int xmax,
                           int ymax,
                           int zmax,
                           int win)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new Client Communication thread.
        Parameters:
        socket - Socket the client Communication class should listen to.
        view - ClientTUI to communicate with the user.
        name - Name of the user's player in case he plays himself.
        strategy - Strategy of the user's player in case he lets a computer player play.
        xmax - Maximal X dimension the user wants to play with.
        ymax - Maximal Y dimension the user wants to play with.
        zmax - Maximal Z dimension the user wants to play with.
        win - Maximal winning length the user wants to play with.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case the streams can not be initialized.

      • ClientCommunication

        public ClientCommunication(view.ClientTUI view,
                           java.lang.String name)
        Constructor needed for testing purposes.
        Parameters:
        view - ClientTUI for the ClientCommunication.
        name - name of player.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Starts the ClientCommunication thread.

      • listen

        public void listen()
        Listens to the incoming messages of the InputStream.

      • react

        public void react(java.lang.String input)
        Reacts to the incoming messages by the protocol and calls the corresponding methods.
        Parameters:
        input - Input of the Server, the method has to react to.

      • write

        public void write(java.lang.String message)
        The method sends messages to the server, writes to the output Stream.
        Parameters:
        message - message to communicate to the server.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Disconnect from the server. Either because of an error detected in the protocol, or after the game finished.

      • serverCapabilities

        public java.lang.String serverCapabilities(java.lang.String[] message)
                                    throws exc.InvalidSyntaxException
        Interprets the serverCapabilities message of the server.
        Parameters:
        message - decomposed message by the server, sending the capabilities.
        Returns:
        answer of the client.
        Throws:
        exc.InvalidSyntaxException - thrown when the syntax of the protocol does not hold.

      • sendClientCapabilities

        public java.lang.String sendClientCapabilities(int amountPlayers,
                                               boolean roomSupport,
                                               int maxX,
                                               int maxY,
                                               int maxZ,
                                               int maxWin,
                                               boolean chat)
        Creates a sending the client's capabilities message according to the protocol.
        Parameters:
        amountPlayers - Amount of players the server can deal wwith in one game.
        roomSupport - whether the server can handle rooms o not.
        maxX - maximal X dimension the server can handle.
        maxY - maximal Y dimension the server can handle.
        maxZ - maximal Z dimension the server can handle.
        maxWin - maximal winning length the server can handle.
        chat - whether the server is able to use chat or not.
        Returns:
        reaction message with the client's capabilities.

      • sendCoordinates

        public java.lang.String sendCoordinates(model.TowerCoordinates move)
        Transfers the coordinates of the next move into a format that can be sent to the server.
        Parameters:
        move - Move the user desires to make.
        Returns:
        Command together with the string representation of the move.

      • makeMe

        public void makeMe(java.lang.String meName,
                   model.Strategy meStrategy,
                   int meID)
        Create the user's player.
        Parameters:
        meName - name of the user's player (human).
        meStrategy - strategy of the user's player (Computer).
        meID - id of the user's player.

      • makeBoard

        public model.Board makeBoard(java.lang.String dimensions)
                      throws exc.InvalidSyntaxException,
                             exc.IllegalBoardConstructorArgumentsException,
                             java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Creates a board from the dimensions given as input. The client Communication thread saves this board.
        Parameters:
        dimensions - String containing the dimensions.
        Returns:
        Copy of the board the client should play on.
        Throws:
        exc.InvalidSyntaxException - in case not all the dimensions are indicated in the string.
        exc.IllegalBoardConstructorArgumentsException - in case the server sends invalid dimensions to create a board.
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - in case the dimensions are not represented as integer.

      • makePlayers

        public java.util.List<model.Player> makePlayers(java.lang.String[] input)
                                         throws exc.InvalidSyntaxException,
                                                java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Creates a list of players from a String array containing all the informations about the different players. It returns a copy of the player for the game for testing purposes.
        Parameters:
        input - Array with all the players. Every element represents one player.
        Returns:
        List of all the players described in the input.
        Throws:
        exc.InvalidSyntaxException - in case not all the information for a player are present.
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - in case the player id is not an integer.

      • giveBoolean

        public boolean giveBoolean(java.lang.String value)
                    throws exc.InvalidSyntaxException
        Determine boolean value out of a String.
        Parameters:
        value - String value representing the boolean.
        Returns:
        the boolean the String represents.
        Throws:
        exc.InvalidSyntaxException - in case the parameter string does not equal TRUE nor FALSE.

      • determineMove

        public model.TowerCoordinates determineMove()
        Determines the next move to play, asks TUI in case of Human Player or the method of Computer Player, handles exceptions before server communication (local check).
        Returns:
        the TowerCoordinates the me-Player wants to play. If the me player or the board is not initialised it returns null.

      • makeMove

        public void makeMove(int newX,
                     int newY,
                     int newID)
        Makes the moves on the board, handles boards exception after getting the coordinates from the server.
        Parameters:
        newX - X Coordinate of the Tower, the player is playing.
        newY - Y Coordinate of the Tower, the player is playing.
        newID - ID of the player whose move it is.

      • determineEnd

        public java.lang.String determineEnd(int reason,
                                     int id)
        Determine the type of end of the game.
        Parameters:
        reason - reason why the game ended.
        id - player ID of the winner, in case of a win.
        Returns:
        String stating the end.

      • determineEnd

        public java.lang.String determineEnd(int reason)
        Determine the type of end of the game.
        Parameters:
        reason - reason why the game ended.
        Returns:
        String stating the end.

      • deleteSpaces

        public java.lang.String deleteSpaces(java.lang.String line)
        The names are not allowed to contain spaces, so the spaces are replaced by "_".
        Parameters:
        line - String maybe with spaces.
        Returns:
        line without spaces.

      • update

        public void update(java.util.Observable observable,
                   java.lang.Object type)
        After a change is made on the board, the client will alert the TUI to print the changed situation.
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer
        Parameters:
        observable - Board to observe.
        type - Type of change the board has made.

      • maxID

        public int maxID()
        Determines the highest ID of the players.
        Returns:
        the highest ID of the players.

      • getError

        public static java.lang.String getError(java.lang.String number)
        Function to get Error message by error code defined in protocol.
        Parameters:
        number - String with error code defined in Protocol
        Returns:
        Error explanation or null if invalid error code.
